text.full: The food (Basil Almond Pesto Pasta) is amazing. Service was excellent (Skylar and bar staff)
I want to give this place 100* everything from food to drinks to service to ambience everything was amazing.

businessPhotos.caption: Whole Milk Creamy Burrata Spread with Sourdough Baguette

text.full:
From the moment we arrived, the host seemed visibly irritated by the size of our party on a weekday. Instead of greeting us politely or trying to accommodate us, they were short-tempered, dismissive, and made us feel unwelcome.  

We have called in to make a reservation and were told that they don't do reservations for Happy Hour. If the restaurant couldn't handle walk-in groups of our size(12 people), they could have simply explained the situation after we have specifically told them we would like to sit closer. Even when we offered to wait or adjust. Instead, the host sighed, rolled their eyes, and spoke to us in a condescending tone as if we were an inconvenience. The host needs to take 101 on hosting

Went here for happy hour with my friends for a birthday. Food was delicious! The pizza was very good, along with the bang bang chicken. The smash burger was good as well but my friends did not necessarily enjoy the caramelized onions on it.

The champagne mango margarita was fire.

The ambience was really chill, clean, and nice. 

Our server was George and he was absolutely lovely. We bantered with him for a bit and the service was fast. Food came out reasonably quickly. We had a great time. Would definitely recommend, especially for happy hour.

This restaurant is located near the water and Pike's Place. It is spacious with multiple tables and a bar inside. The business makes their own pasta, dough for their pizza, and alcohol in house. 

Our sever, George, was personable, kind, and helpful. He recommended the carnitas avocado pizza. It was really good. The pizza dough was soft and flavorful. There was a nice amount of meat on my pizza. The unique combination of toppings on my pizza that paired well together. The pizza was large enough to share or have leftovers for later. 

I enjoyed the bourbon with homemade ice cream. I would definitely return and try other food options.

We visited as a party of four. When it came time to pay, our server asked if we wanted one bill or to split the check. We chose to split. The server brought over a handheld Toast point-of-sale machine, took each of our cards, and immediately presented the tip screen (with 18%, 20%, and 22% pre-calculated options) before showing us an itemized bill.

I tipped 20% and then asked for a printed receipt. That's when I noticed a separate line item called "Cook Commission - 5%" added to the pre-tip total. This meant my actual tip ended up being 25% -- but I had no idea at the time because I wasn't shown the bill beforehand.

At every other restaurant I've been to, you're shown an itemized check first so you know the exact charges before deciding on a tip. Here, we were essentially tipping "blind" without being told about the extra 5% charge.

I find this practice non-transparent and, in my opinion, unethical. I hope the management reconsiders how they present bills so guests can make informed tipping decisions.

All the food and drinks were pretty good, I give it a 8/10. Nothing was amazing but nothing was bad! The vibes inside here are rly nice and dim. Service was nice and accommodating. I would come here again!

businessPhotos.caption: Seattle Classic Summer Stone Fruit Pizza
Espresso Euphoria lemon drop Papaya Mule

text.full: Super upbeat and touristy vibe, but in the best way. I came here a few times before officially moving to Seattle, and every visit was spot-on. The food, the atmosphere, the service, everything was great. They've got a solid drink selection too, which is always a bonus. The portions were huge and filling so I definitely didn't leave hungry. If I'm ever in the area again, I'd happily come back as parking is not an easy task around here.

Had drinks and appetizers on Saturday night it was super busy and there were 7 of us. Chris was our server and he was amazing!! Everything came out só fast! He was só personable and realized we were celebrating my daughter's engagement and brought out a special dessert with a sparkler!!! It was só fun!! He really went above and beyond in the guest experience department!! Thanks so much!!

Food and service was great. It was the first time at this location and it was a beautiful day with the windows open. My only challenge is both locations get pretty noisy, so sometimes it's hard to have a quieter conversation. Love the food - everything has been great and we are going to buy some of the dry pasta to take home next time.
Kinsey and Patrick were a great duo who made us laugh while enjoying delicious cocktails
Kinsey has an amazing sense of humor and made us laugh so much! Patrick was a great bartender, drinks were perfect.

Ocean was awesome and made our experience. He was very kind and helpful. We got the smash burger and the lil pep pizza and both were delicious. The burger was cheesy and loaded with onions and the sourdough crust and hot honey on the pizza left us wanting more. The ambiance was more of a sophisticated dive bar vibe which isn't a knock the food was bomb and the drink list and bar were huge. If we are in Seattle again we will be back.

Vons is the perfect happy hour spot to go to! Staff is nice and even if it is crowded there's still seating available depending how big your party is. The drinks were buzzing and refreshing and the pizza was to die for the perfect sharing size. The bolognese pasta was amazing with the fresh pasta and flavorful sauce it is easily one of the best pasta dishes I have had in the city. Already craving to go back there already!!

Food?  Well, I'll get back to that. 

Ambiance : located in the heart of a super high traffic area. perfect for folks who may not know any better or looking for something convenient.

Service?  Keep on reading . . . 

I went in and was told it'd be a 30 minute wait. Sure. Normally that would be a NO but today, that's okay. 

23 minutes come and go, people are leaving while other people are walking up and getting seated, so I ask, how much longer?

I was told, you've only waited 23 minutes?!?! ***pfff***  it'll just be another 15 more minutes or so.

NO.

Hell to the NO. Get over yourself. I get you think you're hot shit for working here but come the fuck on and at least try to pretend you know how to do your job. 

We bounced.

So back to the food, I wouldn't know. And I doubt I ever will. 

Peace.

This is an incredible place in Seattle. The vibes are cool, the homemade pasta was delicious, and our server, Justin, was helpful & knowledgable. My mushroom pizza was delicious and so was my husband's pasta dish. I will say I felt everything needed salt, which was the only downfall really. Overall, very good lunch!

Awesome food. Big portions. Amazing staff. We had Cece as our waiter, and her service couldn't have been better. Great menu recommendations and made our kids feel like queens! Would definitely come here again.

Creative menu and cool atmosphere.  We have been here three times and each time we are impressed. Great sourdough pasta and pizza.  Sourdough history in Seattle goes back to at least the late 1800's, and these guys keep the heritage alive.

Food was great. The hostess was extremely rude and unaccommodating. We had a baby, and she was dead set against us having the stroller by our table and just gave us overall attitude throughout all interactions with her. Fortunately, our server saved the day and we were able to park the stroller at the table (did she even check?) and everything was all good.
Von's is a great spot right by the market. Worth a trip. Say hi to Patrick, he's great!
Patrick rocks!! Super knowledgeable and friendly. Worth a trip when you're by the market.
loved the outside terrace, the funny and attentive server, and the outstanding food. Their hummus was off the chain!

Kinsey - 
What an awesome experience.  She was very attentive, and her level of service was  the best.  I had to redo my burger because of a food allergy's.  She went above and beyond to get the burger re-made.  From top to bottom and still had a smile on her face. 
Man if she was in California - I would definitely hire her, and she would go far at Costco. Truly amazing.

Omg! Besides the food and drinks being fabulous the absolute topper was Kinsey. She was the cherry on top. She was beyond attentive and we were a large party so I get it. It's not easy. Her attitude and genuine kindness was much appreciated. We're in town in the middle of a week long conference and she was the perfect ending to a long day of work. Kinsey you are Superstar! Thank you :)

Visiting from LA and stopped in for a few drinks. Food and ambiance was on point. Good food, good drinks, great service. Thank you Kinsey! We had 7 guests with separate checks and she handled our group with a smile.
Kinsey was amazing.  Very friendly, Trump and attentive. We had a complicated order and she was perfect in handling it.  Great job

I have never had anything disappointing from Von's in the several visits. Their sourdough bread for pizza and pasta is amazing! They have unique and delicious drinks, alcoholic and nonalcoholic. The restaurant is always busy but service is amazing, friendly and fast. The atmosphere is perfect for downtown Seattle. I highly recommend and bring all of out of town guests here.

After a trip to the market, we decided to stop at Vons for lunch since we'd heard great things. The restaurant has a laid-back, fun vibe with outdoor bar-style seating as well as indoor tables. We were greeted right away and seated quickly.

We started with the chips and guac appetizer, which also came with peppadew cheese. I will be honest, It ended up being way better than I expected. 

For entrees, one person ordered the bacon burger with fries, another had the cod tacos, and I had the avocado and bacon burger. Everyone loved their food. Honestly, my burger was one of the top 5 I've ever had. Absolutely delicious.

The fries were just okay. The seasoning was great, and even though I usually don't care for fries with the skin on, the flavor won me over. They just needed a little more crisp, they were pretty soft.

Overall, I'd definitely go back if I find myself in Seattle again. The menu had a ton of great options I'd still love to try.

Also, shout out to our server, he was super friendly and attentive. Great service all around. You should give them a try.
i would give 10 if Kim was my server every time. she was so fun and interactive, definitely will be returning for her :)

Von's 1000 Spirits - A Disappointing Detour in an Otherwise Lovely Weekend

We came up to Seattle from Olympia for a relaxing weekend getaway--dinner and a show at the Symphony just up the street. Unfortunately, our experience at Von's 1000 Spirits was a major letdown.

To start, our drink order was completely botched. We asked for a Mudslide on the rocks and a Sazerac with Basil Hayden. What arrived 20 minutes later was a Vanilla Vodka on the rocks and a Greyhound with absinthe--neither of which we ordered. Our server, Fernando, seemed to have a language barrier, so I made sure to enunciate clearly when reordering. The second attempt brought us a Sazerac (a very light 1 oz pour, no garnish) and a White Russian--still not what we asked for.

The cocktails were overpriced and poorly made. $18 for a Vanilla Vodka with a $2 upcharge for a Mudslide? $18 for Basil Hayden with a $4 upcharge for a Sazerac? These are tourist trap prices for drinks that didn't even match the order.

For food, we ordered:

Von's Cacio e Pepe Pizza - This was the only highlight. Cheesy, melty, and nicely balanced with hot honey and pepper.
Lemon Garlic Prawns - What we received was a mixed pasta dish with rigatoni and lasagna noodles, red sauce, tomatoes, something green, and what tasted like a tablespoon of chili flakes. No lemon, no capers, no cream. It was inedible.
When we asked for the check, Fernando said he'd remove the pasta. He then presented a $95 bill without showing the itemized receipt--just inserted my card and showed the tip screen. I asked to see the breakdown, and suddenly the bill dropped to $66. That's a big red flag.

To top it off, when I questioned the pasta, the manager--bald, tattooed, and with a confrontational attitude--told me, "That's the way it's supposed to be." Not exactly the hospitality I'd expect from a place with a 4.5-star Yelp rating and $$ pricing.

Bottom line: I felt deceived and taken advantage of. Between the drink mix-ups, overpriced cocktails, inedible food, and shady billing practices, I would not recommend Von's to anyone. There are far better places in Seattle that respect their guests and deliver on their promises.
